article.title: San Francisco
article.p:
San Francisco
, American dramatic film, released in 1936, that recounted the
San Francisco earthquake of 1906
. It is noted for the performances of its cast and for what were, for its time, stunning special effects.

Gable, MacDonald, and Tracy delivered strong performances, though Gable, who was warned of MacDonald’s reputation as a prima donna, had been reluctant to do the film. Although he never warmed to her off the set, their chemistry on-screen is considerable. Tracy earned an
Academy Award
nomination for his role as the tough neighborhood priest. For many, however, the highlight of the film is the depiction of the earthquake, brought to life by sophisticated special effects. The title song, “San Francisco,” was later made one of the city’s official songs.

list.item: Producers: John Emerson and Bernard H. Hyman
Music: Herbert Stothart and Edward Ward
